snippet: The first lady has been opening up about her own struggles and the “insults and slights” that even living in the White House has not protected her family from.
abstract: First Lady Michelle Obama shares her own experiences and struggles with race and achievement in string of commencement speeches, adding her voice to national dialogue on subject; Obama has used her life story to try and inspire young people, particularly African-Americans, and confesses that even as first lady she has had to contend with questions and speculation rooted in fear or misperception.
lead_paragraph: The first lady has been opening up about her own struggles and the “insults and slights” that even living in the White House has not protected her family from.

headline.main: Michelle Obama Talks About Race and Success, and Makes It Personal
headline.print_headline: First Lady Opens Up About Race and Success
